title.narrative: CHILD SAFETY AND REDUCED INJURIES

description.narrative: Output 2.6: National authorities resource inter-sectoral initiatives to advance child safety and reduce mortality and disability from injuries in children, which contributes to Child Health, Child Protection â€“ General, Disaster Risk Reduction, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 2: Children, especially those in difficult life circumstances, suffer, witness and practice less psychological and physical maltreatment, including all forms of harm, abuse, neglect, and exploitation at home, in school, in care, in custody and in public spaces.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.6: National authorities resource inter-sectoral initiatives to advance child safety and reduce mortality and disability from injuries in children

description.narrative: Child injury prevention measures are integrated to the State Health Development Programme and State Education Development Programme 2020-2025. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2020

title.narrative: % of school-age children in disaster-prone districts of Kazakhstan which are aware of coping mechanism in the event of disaster (by gender, rural/urban)

baseline.value: 3,28 % (69,000) in 2017 are aware of coping mechanism in disasters as a result of UNICEF-supported DRR programme: (school-age children in 9 disaster prone regions)

target.value: 2020:at least 20% school-age children in disaster-prone districts

title.narrative: Status of the implementation of the national, multi-sectoral Action Plan on Decreasing Child Mortality from Injuries and Accidents and on Prevention of Injuries in Children

target.value: 2020:By end 2020, Roadmap on child injury prevention endorsed by relevant ministries, fully budgeted and its implementation monitored at national level.

actual.value: 2019:The Strategy and Action plan on prevention of child injuries for 2020-2022 are developed but not fully budgeted. The relevant parts on child injuries prevention are being incorporated into 2020-2025 new Health development Programme and 2020-2023 new Action Plan on Children's safety and budgeted.

title.narrative: Percentage of surveyed population (children, parents, relevant care givers tbd.) aware of the main causes and remedies of child mortality and disability arising from injury

baseline.value: road safety - 67.32%, water safety - 49.33%, smoke detectors - 15.7 %, first aid courses - 38.67 %

actual.value: 2019:Outcomes of the KAP inform communication strategy on child injury prevention
